title: Can an immigration officer in the airport or CBP take away your greencard if you stay out of country for not more than 6 months?
question: Can an immigration officer in the airport or CBP take away your greencard if you stay outside the country for not more than 6 months?and majority of your stay is outside of US.
question_tags: Immigration,US visas,B-2 tourist visa,Bankruptcy,Debt,Debt relief,Bankruptcy and debt
answers:
Yes the immigration officer can take away your green card. You should consult with an immigration attorney to discuss you legal options. You may have some valid defenses.

If you have any further questions you can contact this office

Yes they can. They will usually ask you to sign that you abandon the greencard and let you in on some tourist visa or humanitarian parole. You can also request to appear in front of the judge to defend your case. I will recommend defending the greencard, if you had good reasons to stay such as medical reasons or other priorities. I would recommend having a lawyer by your side when you defend the case.
